reg:regulation.reg:title:
Rule 71-802
Distributions Outside of British Columbia
Under the United States Multijurisdictional Disclosure System
reg:regulation.reg:amsincluded: [includes amendments up to B.C. Reg. 59/2008, March 17, 2008]

bcl:section.bcl:text: In this Rule a term that is defined or interpreted in the Securities Act has the meaning ascribed to it in that Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Non-British Columbia Offerings by Canadian Issuers
bcl:section.bcl:text: An issuer incorporated under the laws of Canada, or a province or territory of Canada, that files a prospectus in respect of a distribution of securities made in compliance with the reciprocal Multijurisdictional Disclosure System adopted by the Securities and Exchange Commission of the United States of America, as amended from time to time, is exempt from subsection 5.9 (1) of National Instrument 41-101 if that prospectus is not used for a distribution of securities in British Columbia.
This Rule comes into force on November 1, 1998.

reg:content.reg:provisionsnote: [Provisions of the Securities Act, R.S.B.C. 1996, c. 418, relevant to the enactment of this regulation: sectionÂ 184]
